@techmatchmaker How would you react as a recruiter or hiring manager if a candidate asked you for the company's compensation spreadsheet?
@techmatchmaker But do you expect them to disclose their present compensation if you won't disclose the company's present compensation info?
@techmatchmaker Candidate can try to learn this info from H1B filings. But usually the information asymmetry favors employer over candidate.
@techmatchmaker Maybe not the entire balance sheet, but at least the distribution of compensation for candidate's peer group at the company.
@techmatchmaker So does that mean you make an offer before you know candidate's current compensation? If not, how do you avoid anchoring?
@techmatchmaker If current comp has little weight, then it's best not to insist on it. Many recruiters insist on knowing, then anchor on it.
@techmatchmaker Sadly true. When I find great recruiters I treasure them.

@techmatchmaker How would you react as a recruiter or hiring manager if a candidate asked you for the company's compensation spreadsheet?
@techmatchmaker But do you expect them to disclose their present compensation if you won't disclose the company's present compensation info?
@techmatchmaker Candidate can try to learn this info from H1B filings. But usually the information asymmetry favors employer over candidate.
@techmatchmaker Maybe not the entire balance sheet, but at least the distribution of compensation for candidate's peer group at the company.
@techmatchmaker So does that mean you make an offer before you know candidate's current compensation? If not, how do you avoid anchoring?
@techmatchmaker If current comp has little weight, then it's best not to insist on it. Many recruiters insist on knowing, then anchor on it.
@techmatchmaker Sadly true. When I find great recruiters I treasure them.
